data.title: XRP Ledger network outage sparks debate over consensus trade-offs
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News Late Tuesday, XRP Ledger was suspended for more than an hour, sparking a heated debate between critics and supporters of the network. Ripple CTO David Schwartz confirmed that XRPL has resumed operation and user funds have not been lost, but the cause of the problem is still under investigation. Some believe that the network outage of more than 1 hour represents a failure of consensus, exposing the network to a critical coordinated attack vector, and criticized the obvious degree of centralization among a relatively small number of trusted validators. In response, Daniel Keller, CTO of blockchain infrastructure company Eminence, said the suspension was "as planned" to ensure the integrity of the ledger. "Every solution has trade-offs. Suspending until a solution is found is one of them." 
The XRP Ledger's network has a total of more than 200 validators. But the number of validators on the unique node list (UNL) trusted by each node is much smaller, and these validators participate in the consensus process. The unique node list (UNL) recommended by the XRPL Foundation contains at least 35 validators. By comparison, although not directly comparable, there are over 1 million active validators on Ethereum, while Bitcoin’s network has at least 65,000 nodes and thousands of miners worldwide. (TheBlock)

data.title: Paxos receives regulatory approval to acquire Finnish e-money firm Membrane Finance
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News: Paxos announced that it has obtained regulatory approval to complete the acquisition of Finnish electronic money institution Membrane Finance. The specific acquisition amount has not been disclosed. After the acquisition is completed, Paxos will become a fully licensed EMI (electronic money institution) in Finland and the European Union. This acquisition enables Paxos to expand its regulated platform to provide services to European customers in a safe and compliant manner. (crowdfundinsider)

data.title: Riot Platforms Reports Increased Bitcoin Production in January
data.description: According to Odaily, Nasdaq-listed mining company Riot Platforms announced on the X platform that it produced 527 BTC in January. Despite the rising network difficulty, the company's production has increased for the second consecutive month. Riot Platforms currently holds 18,221 BTC.

data.title: U.S. Congressional Research Agency Raises Policy Issues Such as Allowing Cryptocurrency Companies to Directly Access the Federal Reserve's Main Account
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News The U.S. Congressional Research Service (CRS) released a report on the Federal Reserve's policy issues, which involved the topics of cryptocurrency and digital currency and outlined some policy issues that Congress may want to consider, including: whether cryptocurrency companies and other non-traditional companies with federal or state banking licenses should be granted direct access to the Federal Reserve's discount window and master account. It is reported that the Federal Reserve previously refused to provide a master account in a legal dispute with Custodia Bank. The U.S. Congressional Research Service is a government organization responsible for outlining issues that the U.S. Congress may want to consider. In addition, the relevant report also involves some other crypto issues, including banks' participation in cryptocurrency business, stablecoins and central bank digital currencies (CBDC). (ledgerinsights)

data.title: U.S. Congress Research Service Explores Federal Reserve Policy on Cryptocurrency
data.description: According to Odaily, the U.S. Congressional Research Service (CRS) has released a report addressing Federal Reserve policy issues, focusing on cryptocurrency and digital currency topics. The report outlines several policy considerations that Congress may wish to explore. Among these is whether cryptocurrency companies and other non-traditional firms with federal or state banking licenses should be granted direct access to the Federal Reserve's discount window and main accounts. Previously, the Federal Reserve denied main account access in a legal dispute with Custodia Bank. The CRS, a government organization, is responsible for outlining topics that the U.S. Congress may consider. The report also covers other cryptocurrency-related issues, including bank involvement in cryptocurrency activities, stablecoins, and central bank digital currencies (CBDCs).
